clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Moxifloxacin in Patients With Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of Moxifloxacin in Patients With Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock:
At the Department of Infectious Diseases, Aarhus Denmark, Moxifloxacin is used in the treatment of severe pneumonia. Due to the risk of cardiac toxicity, it is not recommended to give more than one dose of 400 mg daily. To investigate if this dose is enough to eradicate the bacteria, the investigators take a blood test from the patients treated with Moxifloxacin to determine the concentration og Moxifloxacin in the blood.
Our hypothesis is, that 400 mg of Moxifloxacin is not enough in the treatment of severe pneumonia.

detailed_description.textblock:
At the Department of Infectious Diseases, Aarhus Denmark, Moxifloxacin is used in the treatment of severe pneumonia. Due to the risk of cardiac toxicity, it is not recommended to give more than one dose of 400 mg daily. To investigate if this dose is enough to eradicate the bacteria, we take a total of 4 blood tests from the patients treated with Moxifloxacin, to determine the concentration og Moxifloxacin in the blood and calculate the pharmacokinetics.
We compare the blood concentration with the minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC)for the bacteria found in the sputum or blood, or with known MIC-values for the most common bacterias causing pneumonia in Denmark.
